original: LINDH, Ernst, överste, Stockholm, f Norrtälje 18/7 79 av handl N L o Hanna Jonsson, gm Alma Gustafsson. Mog.ex Upps 99, ex KTH (VoV) 03. Ulöjtn i Fortif:s res 04, löjtn 08, löjtn VVK 10, kapt 18, major (av i Fortif :s res) 24, öv.löjtn 30, överste o ch VVK 34. Bitr ing v Väg- o vattenbyggn.styr 04, kontr o arb.led f kasernbyggn i Umeå 05—08, l:e byråing o ch f Arméns kasernbyggn.nmds byggn.byrå 08—18, byggn.ch v o led av denna nmd 18—25, byggn.ch i o led av Byggn.styr 25, sakk i Tredje försvarsberedn 13, h Stat byggn.byrå 20, deleg v bostadskongr i London 20, i Tyskl 21, sakk f utredn om anskaff av mtrl åt egnahemsbygg 20, k m :ts uppdr att stud statl husbyggn i Danm 23 o bombskador i Finl 40, led av Byggn.styr :s sakk 23—25, res.bef.sakk 25—26, 34 års byggn.ind.sakk 34— 38, civ.-byggn.utredn sed. 40, ordf i inil.-byggn.utredn sed. 40, sakk f utredn rör vissa verkst.skolor 42—43, led av komm f byggn.-tekn forskn sed. 42. Ordf i Sv Arméns Res.-off.frb 24—41, samt i Sällsk -Norrtäljekamraterna. Studieresor i Norge, Finl, Danm, Tyskl. Frankr, Ital o Span. KNO2kl, KVO 2kl, Sv Arméris Res.off.frbs Ht; LKrVa. Frimurare, Arla Coldinu. Hobby: Botanik.
translated: LINDH, Ernst, Colonel, Stockholm, b Norrtälje 18/7 79 to merchant N L and Hanna Jonsson, m Alma Gustafsson. Formerly studied at Uppsala University in 1899, and KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) in 1903. Second Lieutenant in the Fortress Reserve in 1904, Lieutenant in 1908, Lieutenant in the Royal Guard Artillery Reserve in 1910, Captain in 1918, Major in the Fortress Reserve in 1924, Lieutenant Colonel in 1930, and Colonel and Chief of the Royal Guard Artillery Reserve in 1934. Assistant Engineer at the Road and Water Construction Board in 1904, contracted and led the construction of barracks in Umeå from 1905 to 1908, First Bureau Officer and Chief of the Army Barracks Building Committee from 1908 to 1918, Building Chief and Head of the Committee from 1918 to 1925, Building Chief and Head of the Building Authority from 1925, expert in the Third Defense Preparedness Commission in 1913, Head of the State Building Office in 1920, delegation for Housing Congresses in London in 1920 and Germany in 1921, expert for the investigation of material procurement for self-built homes in 1920, appointed by the King to study state house construction in Denmark in 1923 and bombing damage in Finland in 1940, member of the Building Committee Expert Group from 1923 to 1925, Reserve Staff Officer Expert from 1925 to 1926, Building Industry Expert from 1934 to 1938, Civil Building Investigation since 1940, Chairman of the Military Building Technical Research Commission since 1940, expert for the investigation of certain vocational schools from 1942 to 1943, member of the Municipal Building Technical Research Commission since 1942. Chairman of the Swedish Army Reserve Officers' Association from 1924 to 1941, and also of the Society - Norrtälje Companions. Study trips to Norway, Finland, Denmark, Germany, France, Italy, and Spain. Knight of the Order of the North Star with the Second Class, Knight of the Order of Vasa with the Second Class, Swedish Army Reserve Officers' Association's Honorary Badge; Member of the Royal Order of Kalmar Union. Freemason, Arla Coldinu. Hobby: Botany.
